intro: Notanthera ligustrifolius, commonly known as the California buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped with a distinctive blue-green hue, and it produces showy, pinkish-white flowers in late spring to early summer. Notanthera ligustrifolius plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often used in native plant landscaping.
